    I am a student of many things, an innovator, a problem solver and a collaborator. I am a good listener who asks questions and shares thoughts. I want to create beautiful & intuitive products that will guide a user through a great experience and add value to their life.

I am a recent participant of Boston Startup School's inaugural class as a member of the Product Design Track. At Startup School I learned the ins and outs of User Experience & User Interface from great minds and industry experts in the Boston area.

Prior to the Startup School I worked as a Research Associate in Washington, D.C. at Economists Incorporated. At EI, I was taught how to use data to

    I graduated from Brandeis University in 2011 with a BA in Economics and a minor in Classical Studies. Upon graduating, I began working as a Research Associate at an economic consulting firm in Washington DC where my main responsibilities involved performing data & statistical analysis for anti-trust litigation on cases with up to $500M at stake.
